titleStmt.title: W. T. Johnson to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2990

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of New Jersey,
DEPARTMENT OF STATE.
Trenton, August 15th 1861
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
The Governor of State of Kentucky
Sir,

In accordance with the provisions of an act entitled "An act relative to the Laws of this State," &c., approved April 16th, 1846, I have this day transmitted by mail The Laws of N. J. for 1861 for the use of the use of the State over which you preside, the receipt of which you will please acknowledge, directed to the Secretary of State, at Trenton.

Respectfully Yours, &c.
W. T. Johnson
Secretary of State.
